  <title>Linear programming and the intersection of free subgroups in free products of groups</title>
  <toctitle>Linear programming and intersection of subgroups in free products</toctitle>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>S. V. Ivanov </personname>
    <contact role="address"> Department of Mathematics<break/>University of Illinois <break/>Urbana<break/>IL 61801<break/>U.S.A. </contact>
    <contact role="email">ivanov@illinois.edu</contact>
  </creator>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>We study the intersection of finitely generated factor-free subgroups of free products of groups by utilizing the method of linear programming. For example, we prove that if <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="m1">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is a finitely generated
factor-free noncyclic subgroup of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}*G_{2}" text="G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="m2">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> of two finite groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}" text="G _ 1" xml:id="m3">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{2}" text="G _ 2" xml:id="m4">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, then the Walter Neumann coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="m5">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="m5.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="m5.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="m6">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is rational and can be computed. This coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="m7">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="m7.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="m7.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is the minimal positive real number such that, for every finitely generated
factor-free subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="m8">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}*G_{2}" text="G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="m9">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, it is true that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2})\leq\sigma(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar{%&#10;\mathrm{r}}(H_{2})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2) less= sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 2" xml:id="m10">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="m10.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="m10.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m10.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m10.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m10.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m10.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m10.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m10.4">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m10.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m10.5">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{{\rm r}}(H)=\max({\rm r}(H)-1,0)" text="bar@(r) * H = maximum@(r * H - 1, 0)" xml:id="m11">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m11.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m11.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="m11.3"/>
                <XMRef idref="m11.5"/>
                <XMRef idref="m11.4"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="m11.3">max</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m11.5">
                    <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="m11.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m11.2">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="m11.4">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is reduced rank of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="m12">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathrm{r}}(H)" text="r * H" xml:id="m13">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="m13.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m13.1">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is rank of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="m14">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="m15">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="m15.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="m15.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="m15.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is reduced rank of a generalized intersection of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1},H_{2}" text="list@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="m16">
        <XMath>
          <XMDual>
            <XMApp>

              </XMApp>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMDual>
        </XMath>
      </Math>.</p>
  </abstract>

    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S1.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, be some nontrivial groups and let
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S1.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote the free product of these groups. According to the classic Kurosh subgroup
theorem <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="K" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="LS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, every subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S1.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a free product <Math mode="inline" tex="F(H)*\prod^{*}t_{{{\alpha},\gamma}}H_{{\alpha},\gamma}t_{{{\alpha},\gamma}}^{-1}" text="F * H * (product ^ *)@(t _ (list@(alpha, gamma)) * H _ (list@(alpha, gamma)) * (t _ (list@(alpha, gamma))) ^ (- 1))" xml:id="S1.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m6.7"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m6.7">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m6.1"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">t</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m6.5"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m6.6"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m6.5">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m6.6">γ</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{{{\alpha},\gamma}}" text="H _ (list@(alpha, gamma))" xml:id="S1.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

            </XMApp>

        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S1.p1.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p2">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}=q^{*}(G_{\alpha},{\alpha}\in I)" xml:id="S1.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote the minimum of orders <Math mode="inline" tex="&gt;2" text="absent &gt; 2" xml:id="S1.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of finite subgroups of groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S1.p2.m4">

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}:=\infty" text="q ^ * assign infinity" xml:id="S1.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if there are no such subgroups. It is clear that either <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}" text="q ^ *" xml:id="S1.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an odd prime or <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}\in\{4,\infty\}" text="q ^ * element-of set@(4, infinity)" xml:id="S1.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S1.p2.m7.1">4</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID" xml:id="S1.p2.m7.2">∞</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}=\infty" text="q ^ * = infinity" xml:id="S1.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, define
<Math mode="inline" tex="\tfrac{q^{*}}{q^{*}-2}:=1" text="q ^ * / (q ^ * - 2) assign 1" xml:id="S1.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Dicks and the author <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> proved that if
<Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p2.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p2.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are finitely generated factor-free subgroups of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p2.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:di" xml:id="S1.E1">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.1)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">1.1</tag>
        </tags>

      </equation>
      <p>Dicks and the author <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> conjectured that if groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.p2.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S1.p2.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, contain no involutions, then the coefficient 2 could be left out and</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:conj" xml:id="S1.E2">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.2)</tag>

        </tags>

      </equation>
      <p>This conjecture can be regarded as a far reaching generalization of the Hanna Neumann conjecture <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="N1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> on rank of the intersection of subgroups in free groups. Recall that the Hanna Neumann conjecture <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="N1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> claims that if <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p2.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p2.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are finitely generated subgroups of a free group, then <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\rm{r}}(H_{1}\cap H_{2})\leq\bar{{\rm r}}(H_{1})\bar{\rm r}(H_{2})" text="bar@(r) * (H _ 1 intersection H _ 2) less= bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p2.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m17.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p2.m17.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m17.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p2.m17.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p2.m17.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p2.m17.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
For more discussion, partial results and proofs of this conjecture the reader is referred to <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fr" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Iv12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Min" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="N2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="St" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="T" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.

    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p3">
      <p>The conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) is established by Dicks and the author <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> in the case when <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the free product of two groups of order 3 in which case <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}=3" text="q ^ * = 3" xml:id="S1.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) turns into</p>
      <equation xml:id="S1.Ex1">

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.1.5"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.1.5">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Another special case in which the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) is known to be true is the case when <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the free product of infinite cyclic groups, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a free group, as follows from Friedman’s <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fr" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and Mineyev’s <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Min" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> proofs of the Hanna Neumann conjecture, see also Dicks’s proof <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. In this case <Math mode="inline" tex="q^{*}=\infty" text="q ^ * = infinity" xml:id="S1.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) turns into</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:HNC" xml:id="S1.E3">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.3)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">1.3</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1}\cap H_{2})\leq\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H%&#10;_{2})." text="bar@(r) * (H _ 1 intersection H _ 2) less= bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.E3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.E3.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.E3.m1.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.E3.m1.1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.E3.m1.1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.E3.m1.1.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.E3.m1.1.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.E3.m1.1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.E3.m1.1.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>More generally, the inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:HNC"/>) also holds in the case when <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the free product of right orderable groups as follows from results of Antolín, Martino, and Schwabrow <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ABC" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, see also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Iv12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.
We mention that it follows from results of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> that the conjectured inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) is sharp and may not be improved.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p4">
      <p>In an attempt to improve on the bound (<ref labelref="LABEL:di"/>) in a special case, Dicks and the author <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> showed that</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:imrn" xml:id="S1.E4">
        <tags>
          <tag>(1.4)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">1.4</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1}\cap H_{2})\leq\left(2-\tfrac{(4+2\sqrt{3})p}{(2p-3+%&#10;\sqrt{3})^{2}}\right)\cdot\tfrac{p}{p-2}\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}%&#10;}(H_{2})" text="bar@(r) * (H _ 1 intersection H _ 2) less= ((2 - ((4 + 2 * square-root@(3)) * p) / ((2 * p - 3) + square-root@(3)) ^ 2) cdot (p / (p - 2))) * bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.E4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>

                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>

                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.E4.m1.1"/>

                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                                  <XMApp>

                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.E4.m1.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S1.E4.m1.2">
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>

                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="square-root"/>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.E4.m1.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.E4.m1.5">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.E4.m1.6"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.E4.m1.6">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>for finitely generated factor-free subgroups <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{p}*C_{p}" text="C _ p * C _ p" xml:id="S1.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of two cyclic groups of prime order <Math mode="inline" tex="p&gt;2" text="p &gt; 2" xml:id="S1.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p5">
      <p>Note that for <Math mode="inline" tex="p=3" text="p = 3" xml:id="S1.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:imrn"/>) yields the conjectured inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>). However, for prime <Math mode="inline" tex="p\geq 5" text="p &gt;= 5" xml:id="S1.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="5" role="NUMBER">5</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the problem whether the inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) holds for the free product of two cyclic groups of order <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S1.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> remains open and seems to be the most basic and appealing case of the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) for groups with torsion. In this connection, we remark that the ideas of articles <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="ABC" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Fr" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Min" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, do not look to be applicable to the case of free products with torsion and shed no light on the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) for free products of groups with torsion, especially, for free products of finite groups.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p6">
      <p>In this article, however, we will not attempt to prove or improve on any upper bounds. Instead, we will look at generalized intersections of finitely generated factor-free subgroups in
free products of groups from a disparate standpoint and prove results of quite different flavor by utilizing the method of linear programming.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p7">
      <p>First we recall a stronger version of the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) that generalizes the strengthened Hanna Neumann
<!--  %**** String Line 100 **** -->conjecture which was put forward by
Walter Neumann <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="N2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> for subgroups of free groups. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be finitely generated factor-free subgroups of an arbitrary free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S1.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S1.p7.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, let the number <Math mode="inline" tex="\tfrac{q^{*}}{q^{*}-2}" text="q ^ * / (q ^ * - 2)" xml:id="S1.p7.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be defined for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p7.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as above, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="S(H_{1},H_{2})" text="S * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S1.p7.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p7.m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p7.m8.2"/>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p7.m8.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p7.m8.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote a set of representatives of those double cosets <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}tH_{2}" text="H _ 1 * t * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p7.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p7.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="t\in{\mathcal{F}}" text="t element-of F" xml:id="S1.p7.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, that have the property <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}\cap tH_{2}t^{-1}\neq\{1\}" text="H _ 1 intersection t * H _ 2 * t ^ (- 1) not-equals set@(1)" xml:id="S1.p7.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>

          </XMath>
        </Math>. Then the strengthened
version of the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conj"/>) claims that</p>

      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S1.p7.m13">

    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p8">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F})}" text="K _ [ff] * F" xml:id="S1.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                <XMText><text font="sansserif" fontsize="70%">ff</text></XMText>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p8.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p8.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote the set of all finitely generated noncyclic factor-free subgroups of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Pick a subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}\in{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F})}" text="H _ 1 element-of K _ [ff] * F" xml:id="S1.p8.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMText><text font="sansserif" fontsize="70%">ff</text></XMText>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p8.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p8.m3.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We will say that a real number <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})&gt;0" text="sigma * H _ 1 &gt; 0" xml:id="S1.p8.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p8.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p8.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the <text font="italic">Walter Neumann coefficient</text> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p8.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, or, briefly, the WN-coefficient for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p8.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, if, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}\in{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F})}" text="H _ 2 element-of K _ [ff] * F" xml:id="S1.p8.m7">
          <XMath>

              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMWrap>

        </Math>, we have</p>

          </XMath>
        </Math> consisting of those subgroups
whose irreducible core graphs have all of its vertices of degree at most <Math mode="inline" tex="d" text="d" xml:id="S1.p9.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, see Sect. 2 for definitions.
<!--  %**** String Line 125 **** -->This number <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}(H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p9.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p9.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p9.m6.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called the WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="S1.p9.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp role="FLOATSUBSCRIPT" scriptpos="2">
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-<text font="italic">coefficient</text> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p9.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Since <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F},d)}\subseteq\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}({%&#10;\mathcal{F}},d+1)" text="K _ [ff] * open-interval@(F, d) subset-of-or-equals K _ [ff] * open-interval@(F, d + 1)" xml:id="S1.p9.m9">
          <XMath>

                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                  <XMWrap>

          </XMath>
        </Math>, it follows from the definitions that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}(H_{1})\leq\sigma_{d+1}(H_{1})\leq\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * H _ 1 less= sigma _ (d + 1) * H _ 1 less= sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p9.m10">

    <para xml:id="S1.p10">
      <p>For example, it folows from results of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv,DIv2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> mentioned above that if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=C_{p}*C_{p}" text="F = C _ p * C _ p" xml:id="S1.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the
free product of two cyclic groups of prime order <Math mode="inline" tex="p&gt;2" text="p &gt; 2" xml:id="S1.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>

              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}\in{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F})}" text="H _ 1 element-of K _ [ff] * F" xml:id="S1.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then</p>
      <equation xml:id="S1.Ex3">

    <para xml:id="S1.p11">
      <p>The main technical result of this article is the following.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:th1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 1.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 1.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 1.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=G_{1}*G_{2}" text="F = G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the free product of two nontrivial groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a finitely generated factor-free noncyclic subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then the following claims are true.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p2">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(a)}" text="a" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p2.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p2.m1.1">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> For every integer <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p2.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, there exists a linear programming problem (LP-problem)</text></p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:lpa" xml:id="S1.E8">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1.8)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1.8</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\mathcal{P}}(H_{1},d)=\max\{c(d)x(d)\mid A(d)x(d)\leq b(d)\}" text="P * open-interval@(H _ 1, d) = maximum@(conditional@(c * d * x * d, A * d * x * d) less= b * d)" xml:id="S1.E8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">with integer coefficients whose solution is equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="-\sigma_{d}(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="- sigma _ d * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p2.m3">

            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(b)}" text="b" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m1">

              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}^{*}=H_{2}^{*}(H_{1})" text="(H _ 2) ^ * = (H _ 2) ^ * * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m4">

              </XMath>
            </Math>, which corresponds to a vertex solution of the dual problem</text></p>

        <p><text font="italic">of the primal LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2}^{*})=\sigma_{d}(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar%&#10;{\mathrm{r}}(H_{2}^{*})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, (H _ 2) ^ *) = sigma _ d * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m5.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m5.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m5.4"/>
                      <XMWrap>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. In particular, the WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p3.m6">

      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(c)}" text="c" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
