                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> There exists a linear semi-infinite programming problem (LSIP-problem) <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}(H_{1})=\sup\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="P * H _ 1 = supremum@(conditional-set@(c * x, A * x less= b))" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m2.3">
                          <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with finitely many variables in <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and with countably many constraints in the system <Math mode="inline" tex="Ax\leq b" text="A * x less= b" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> whose dual problem</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S1.Ex6">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\mathcal{P}}^{*}(H_{1})=\inf\{b^{\top}y\mid A^{\top}y=c^{\top},\,y\geq 0\}" text="P ^ * * H _ 1 = infimum@(conditional-set@(b ^ top * y, formulae@(A ^ top * y = c ^ top, y &gt;= 0)))" xml:id="S1.Ex6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>

                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex6.m1.3"/>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex6.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S1.Ex6.m1.3">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.Ex6.m1.3.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.Ex6.m1.3.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex6.m1.3.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex6.m1.3.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">has a solution equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="-\sigma(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="- sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p4.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(d)}" text="d" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m1.1"/>

                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> Let the word problem for both groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m2.1"/>

                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be solvable
and let an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m3.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be given. Then the
LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) can be effectively written down and the
WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUBSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}(H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m6.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> can be computed.
In addition, an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{2}^{*})" text="Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>

                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of the subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}^{*}" text="(H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p5.m9">

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of part (b) can be effectively constructed.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(e)}" text="e" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m1">

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> Let both <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m2.1">

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be finite, let <Math mode="inline" tex="d:=\max(|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|)\geq 3" text="d assign maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2)) &gt;= 3" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.1">max</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.2">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.3">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m3.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and
let an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m4.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be given.
Then the LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) coincides with the
LSIP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}(H_{1})" text="P * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m6.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of part (c) and the WN-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m7.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm1.p6.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
rational and computable.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p12">
      <p>It is worthwhile to mention that the correspondence <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}\to y(H_{2})" text="H _ 2 to y * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> between subgroups <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}\in{\mathcal{K}_{\textsf{ff}}(\mathcal{F},d)}" text="H _ 2 element-of K _ [ff] * open-interval@(F, d)" xml:id="S1.p12.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMText><text font="sansserif" fontsize="70%">ff</text></XMText>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m2.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m2.2">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, with a special property (Bd), see Sect. 3, and vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="y(H_{2})" text="y * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p12.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the feasible polyhedron <Math mode="inline" tex="\{y(d)\mid A(d)^{\top}y(d)=c(d)^{\top},\,y(d)\geq 0\}" text="conditional-set@(y * d, formulae@(A * d ^ top * y * d = c * d ^ top, y * d &gt;= 0))" xml:id="S1.p12.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>

                <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.7"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m4.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                  <XMDual>

                    <XMWrap>

                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                <XMDual xml:id="S1.p12.m4.7">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m4.7.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m4.2">d</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m4.3">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.4"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m4.4">d</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m4.7.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.5"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m4.5">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the dual problem <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}^{*}(H_{1},d)" text="P ^ * * open-interval@(H _ 1, d)" xml:id="S1.p12.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m5.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p12.m5.1">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, that is mentioned in part (b) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/>, plays an important role in proofs and is reminiscent of the correspondence between (almost) normal surfaces in 3-dimensional manifolds and their (resp. almost) normal vectors in the Haken theory of normal surfaces and its generalizations, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Haken,HLP,Hemion,Iv08s,JT" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. In particular, the idea of a vertex solution works equally well both in the context of almost normal surfaces <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Iv08s" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, see also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="HLP,JT" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and in the context of factor-free subgroups, providing in either situation both the connectedness of the underlying object represented by a vertex solution and an upper bound on size of the underlying object.
<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p13">
      <p>Relying on the linear programming approach of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/>, in the following Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th2"/>, we look at the computational complexity of the problem to calculate the WN-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p13.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p13.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for a factor-free subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p13.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the free product of two finite groups.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:th2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 1.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 1.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 1.2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=G_{1}*G_{2}" text="F = G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the free product of two nontrivial finite groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> given by a finite generating set <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of words over the alphabet
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}=G_{1}\cup G_{2}" text="A = G _ 1 union G _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then the following are true.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(a)}" text="a" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> In deterministic polynomial time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, one can
determine whether <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is factor-free and noncyclic and, if so, one can construct an irreducible graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}(H_{1})" text="Psi _ o * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m4.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p2.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(b)}" text="b" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> If <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is factor-free and noncylcic, then, in deterministic exponential time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, one can write down and solve an LP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}=\max\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="P = maximum@(conditional@(c * x, A * x) less= b)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m4.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m4.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m4.1">max</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m4.2">
                          <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> whose solution is equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="-\sigma(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="- sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. In particular, the <Math mode="inline" tex="WN" text="W * N" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m7.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is computable in deterministic exponential time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(c)}" text="c" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m1.1">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> If <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is factor-free and noncylcic, then, in deterministic double exponential time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, one can construct an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{2}^{*})" text="Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m4.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}^{*}" text="(H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}^{*}" text="(H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a finitely generated factor-free subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that
<Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2}^{*})=\sigma(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar{%&#10;\mathrm{r}}(H_{2}^{*})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, (H _ 2) ^ *) = sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.3">

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.4"/>
                      <XMWrap>

                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>

                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.5"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m8.5">

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
In addition, if <Math mode="inline" tex="|E\Psi|" text="absolute-value@(E * Psi)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> denotes the number of oriented edges of a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m11.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is an irreducible core graph of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="d:=\max(|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|)" text="d assign maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2))" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

                  <XMDual>

                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13.1"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13.1">max</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13.2">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>

                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13.3">
                          <XMApp>

                            <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m13.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then
<Math mode="inline" tex="|E\Psi(H_{2}^{*})|&lt;2^{2^{4|E\Psi(H_{1})|+1+\log_{2}\log_{2}(2d)}}." text="absolute-value@(E * Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *) less 2 ^ 2 ^ (4 * absolute-value@(E * Psi * H _ 1) + 1 + (logarithm _ 2)@((logarithm _ 2)@(2 * d)))" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.4">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>

                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.4.1"/>

                          <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.4.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.4.1.1"/>

                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                              <XMDual>

                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.1.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMDual>

                                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.2"/>

                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p4.m14.3">
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p14">
      <p>The situation with free products of more than two factors is more difficult to study and we will make additional efforts to obtain the following.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:th3" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 1.3</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1.3</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 1.3</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 1.3</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
the free product of nontrivial groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** -->finitely generated factor-free noncyclic subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then there are two disjoint finite subsets
<Math mode="inline" tex="I_{1},I_{2}" text="list@(I _ 1, I _ 2)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m6.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m6.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="I" text="I" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that if
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}G_{1}:=\prod_{\alpha\in I_{1}}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="widehat@(absent) * G _ 1 assign ((product _ (alpha element-of I _ 1)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                          </XMApp>

                      </XMApp>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}G_{2}:=\prod_{\alpha\in I_{2}}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="widehat@(absent) * G _ 2 assign ((product _ (alpha element-of I _ 2)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}{\mathcal{F}}:={\widehat{}}G_{1}*{\widehat{}}G_{2}" text="widehat@(absent) * F assign widehat@(absent) * G _ 1 * widehat@(absent) * G _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m10">

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>

              </XMath>
            </Math>, then there exists a finitely generated factor-free subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p1.m11">

              <XMath>

            </Math>.</text></p>

      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(b)}" text="b" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m1">
            <XMath>

            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> If the word problem for all groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I_{1}\cup I_{2}" text="alpha element-of I _ 1 union I _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m3">
              <XMath>

                    </XMApp>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
is solvable and a finite irreducible graph of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is given, then the
LP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}({\widehat{}}H_{1},d)" text="P * open-interval@(widehat@(absent) * H _ 1, d)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                    <XMWrap>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
