                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of part (a) of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/> can be effectively written down and the WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUBSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}({\widehat{}}H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m8.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m8.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> can be computed.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(c)}" text="c" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m1.1">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> Let groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I_{1}\cup I_{2}" text="alpha element-of I _ 1 union I _ 2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
be finite, let <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be effectively given either by
a finite irreducible graph or by a finite generating set, and let</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S1.Ex7">
          <Math mode="display" tex="d^{\prime}:=\max\{|I_{1}\cup I_{2}|,\max\{|G_{\alpha}|\,:\,{\alpha}\in I_{1}%&#10;\cup I_{2}\}\}." text="d ^ prime assign maximum@(absolute-value@(I _ 1 union I _ 2), maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ alpha) colon alpha element-of I _ 1 union I _ 2))" xml:id="S1.Ex7.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.Ex7.m1.3"/>

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Ex7.m1.2"/>

                          <XMDual xml:id="S1.Ex7.m1.3.2">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.Ex7.m1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.Ex7.m1.3.2.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>

                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex7.m1.3.2.1">
                                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">:</XMTok>

                                      <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>

                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>

                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d^{\prime}}({\widehat{}}H_{1})\geq\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma _ (d ^ prime) * widehat@(absent) * H _ 1 &gt;= sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m5.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
and there is an algorithm that decides whether the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conjs"/>) holds for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.Thmthm3.p4.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p15">
      <p>We remark that proofs of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:th2"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:th3"/> provide a practical deterministic algorithm
<!--  %**** String Line 225 **** -->(with exponential running time, though) to compute the WN-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p15.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for a finitely generated factor-free subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p15.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the free product of two finite groups and to determine whether a certain finitely generated factor-free subgroup of a free product of finite groups satisfies the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conjs"/>). It seems to be of interest to implement this algorithm and experiment with it.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S1.p16">
      <p>The article is structured as follows.
In Sect. 2, we define basic notions and recall geometric ideas that are used to study finitely generated factor-free subgroups and their intersections in a free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p16.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In particular, we define a finite labeled graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S1.p16.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m2.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> associated with such a subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S1.p16.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p16.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In Sect. 3, we consider the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=G_{1}*G_{2}" text="F = G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="S1.p16.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of two nontrivial groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.p16.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m6.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m6.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m6.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m6.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and introduce certain linear inequalities associated with the groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S1.p16.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m7.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m7.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m7.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and with a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p16.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m8.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p16.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p16.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a finitely generated factor-free noncyclic subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p16.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Informally, these inequalities are used for construction of cores of potential fiber product graphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})\times\Psi(H_{2})" text="Psi * H _ 1 * Psi * H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p16.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m12.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m12.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m12.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m12.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S1.p16.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is another finitely generated factor-free subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S1.p16.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and subsequent translation to linear programming. More formally, these inequalities enable us to define an LP-problem
<Math mode="inline" tex="\max\{c(d)x(d)\mid A(d)x(d)\leq b(d)\}," text="maximum@(conditional@(c * d * x * d, A * d * x * d) less= b * d)" xml:id="S1.p16.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.7"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S1.p16.m15.7">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.6"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.6">max</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m15.7.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.1">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.2">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.3">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.4"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.4">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m15.5"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m15.5">d</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
corresponding to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p16.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m16.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m16.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and to an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="S1.p16.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and to define an LSIP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="supremum@(conditional-set@(c * x, A * x less= b))" xml:id="S1.p16.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m18.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m18.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m18.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m18.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, corresponding to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S1.p16.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m19.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m19.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We also consider and make use of the dual problems of the primal problems <Math mode="inline" tex="\max\{c(d)x(d)\mid A(d)x(d)\leq b(d)\}" text="maximum@(conditional@(c * d * x * d, A * d * x * d) less= b * d)" xml:id="S1.p16.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.6"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.7"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.6">max</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m20.7">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.1">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.2">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.3">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.4">d</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m20.5"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p16.m20.5">d</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\sup\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="supremum@(conditional-set@(c * x, A * x less= b))" xml:id="S1.p16.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m21.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p16.m21.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m21.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p16.m21.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Basic results and terminology of linear programming are recalled in Sect. 4.
These LP-, LSIP-problems and their dual problems are investigated in Sects. 3–4. In Sect. 5, we look at the case of free products of more than two groups and prove a few more technical lemmas. Proofs of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/>–<ref labelref="LABEL:th3"/> are given in Sect. 6.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S2">
    <tags>
      <tag>2</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§2</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">2</tag>Preliminaries</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">2</tag>Preliminaries</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S2.p1">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S2.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, be nontrivial
groups, let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S2.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be their free product, and let <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a finitely generated factor-free subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H\neq\{1\}" text="H not-equals set@(1)" xml:id="S2.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m6.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p1.m6.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Consider the alphabet <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}=\cup_{{\alpha}\in I}G_{\alpha}" text="A = union _ (alpha element-of I) G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}\cap G_{{\alpha}^{\prime}}=\{1\}" text="G _ alpha intersection G _ (alpha ^ prime) = set@(1)" xml:id="S2.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p1.m8.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p1.m8.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\neq{\alpha}^{\prime}" text="alpha not-equals alpha ^ prime" xml:id="S2.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p2">
      <p>Analogously to the graph-theoretic approach of articles <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="DIv,DIv2,Iv99,Iv01,Iv08,Iv10,Iv12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>,
we first define a labeled <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S2.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p2.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p2.m2.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which geometrically represents <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in a manner similar to the way Stallings graphs represent subgroups of a free group, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="St" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p3">
      <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a graph, <Math mode="inline" tex="V\Gamma" text="V * Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denotes the vertex set of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m3">

<!--  %**** String Line 250 **** -->A closed path <Math mode="inline" tex="p=e_{1}\dots e_{k}" text="p = e _ 1 * dots * e _ k" xml:id="S2.p3.m34">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text font="italic">cyclically reduced</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="|p|&gt;0" text="absolute-value@(p) &gt; 0" xml:id="S2.p3.m35">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m35.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p3.m35.1">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and both <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p3.m36">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the cyclic permutation
<Math mode="inline" tex="e_{2}\dots e_{k}e_{1}" text="e _ 2 * dots * e _ k * e _ 1" xml:id="S2.p3.m37">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p3.m38">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are reduced paths. The <text font="italic">core</text> of a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m39">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, denoted <Math mode="inline" tex="\mbox{core}(\Gamma)" text="[core] * Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m40">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMText>core</XMText>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p3.m40.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p3.m40.1">Γ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>,
is the minimal subgraph of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m41">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that contains every edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.p3.m42">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which
can be included into a cyclically reduced path in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p3.m43">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p4">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a graph whose vertex set <Math mode="inline" tex="V\Psi" text="V * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> consists of two disjoint nonempty parts <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{P}\Psi,V_{S}\Psi" text="list@(V _ P * Psi, V _ S * Psi)" xml:id="S2.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m3.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m3.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m3.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m3.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, so <Math mode="inline" tex="V\Psi=V_{P}\Psi\cup V_{S}\Psi" text="V * Psi = V _ P * Psi union V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Vertices in <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{P}\Psi" text="V _ P * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are called <text font="italic">primary</text> and vertices in <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{S}\Psi" text="V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are called <text font="italic">secondary</text>.
Every edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in E\Psi" text="e element-of E * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> connects primary and secondary vertices, hence <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a bipartite graph. <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called a <text font="italic">labeled <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph</text>, or briefly <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p4.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math><text font="italic">-graph</text>, if <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is equipped with functions</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\varphi}:E\Psi\to{\mathcal{A}},\qquad{\theta}:V_{S}\Psi\to I," text="varphi colon (E * Psi to list@(A, theta)) colon (V _ S * Psi to I)" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex1.m1.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1.1">A</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="20.0pt">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex1.m1.2">θ</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>called <text font="italic">labeling</text>, such that, for every edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in E\Psi" text="e element-of E * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, it is true that
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)\in{\mathcal{A}}=\cup_{{\alpha}\in I}G_{\alpha}" text="varphi * e element-of A = union _ (alpha element-of I) G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p4.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m14.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m14.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e^{-1})={\varphi}(e)^{-1}" text="varphi * e ^ (- 1) = varphi * e ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S2.p4.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m15.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m15.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m15.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m15.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and, if
<Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}\in V_{S}\Psi" text="e _ + element-of V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)\in G_{\alpha}" text="varphi * e element-of G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p4.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m17.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m17.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}={\theta}(e_{+})" text="alpha = theta * e _ +" xml:id="S2.p4.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m18.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m18.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}\in V_{S}\Psi" text="e _ + element-of V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, define
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e):={\theta}(e_{+})" text="theta * e assign theta * e _ +" xml:id="S2.p4.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m20.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m20.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m20.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m20.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e^{-1}):={\theta}(e_{+})" text="theta * e ^ (- 1) assign theta * e _ +" xml:id="S2.p4.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m21.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m21.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m21.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and call <Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e_{+})" text="theta * e _ +" xml:id="S2.p4.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m22.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p4.m22.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e)" text="theta * e" xml:id="S2.p4.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m23.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m23.1">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the <text font="italic">type</text> of a vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}\in V_{S}\Psi" text="e _ + element-of V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and of an edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in E\Psi" text="e element-of E * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Thus, for every <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in E\Psi" text="e element-of E * Psi" xml:id="S2.p4.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, we have defined an element
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)\in{\mathcal{A}}" text="varphi * e element-of A" xml:id="S2.p4.m27">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m27.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m27.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, called the  label of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.p4.m28">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and an element <Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e)\in I" text="theta * e element-of I" xml:id="S2.p4.m29">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p4.m29.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p4.m29.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, termed the type of <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.p4.m30">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p5">
      <p>The reader familiar with van Kampen diagrams over a free product of groups,
as defined in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="LS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, will recognize that our labeling function <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}:E\Psi\to{\mathcal{A}}" text="varphi colon E * Psi to A" xml:id="S2.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is defined in the way analogous to labeling functions on van Kampen diagrams over free products of groups. Recall that van Kampen diagrams are planar 2-complexes whereas graphs are 1-complexes, however, apart from this, the ideas of cancelations and edge folding work equally well for both diagrams and graphs.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p6">
      <p>An <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text font="italic">irreducible</text> if properties (P1)–(P3) hold true:</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S2.I1">
        <item xml:id="S2.I1.ix1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(P1)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item (P1)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.ix1.p1">
            <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="e,f\in E\Psi" text="list@(e, f) element-of E * Psi" xml:id="S2.I1.ix1.p1.m1">

                    </XMApp>

                </XMath>

          </para>
        </item>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>

                <XMath>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}=f_{+}\in V_{S}\Psi" text="e _ + = f _ + element-of V _ S * Psi" xml:id="S2.I1.ix2.p1.m3">

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    </XMApp>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, then <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)\neq{\varphi}(f)" text="varphi * e not-equals varphi * f" xml:id="S2.I1.ix2.p1.m4">

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
