                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.I1.ix2.p1.m4.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I1.ix2.p1.m4.2">f</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{{\theta}(e)}" text="G _ (theta * e)" xml:id="S2.I1.ix2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>

                      <XMDual>

                        <XMWrap>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>

                </XMath>
              </Math>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S2.I1.ix3">
          <tags>
            <tag>(P3)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item (P3)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.ix3.p1">
            <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.I1.ix3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> has no multiple edges, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mbox{deg}_{\Psi}v&gt;0" text="[deg] _ Psi * v &gt; 0" xml:id="S2.I1.ix3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMText>deg</XMText>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in V\Psi" text="v element-of V * Psi" xml:id="S2.I1.ix3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>,
and there is at most one vertex of degree 1 in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.I1.ix3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which, if exists, is primary.
<!--  %**** String Line 275 **** --></p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p7">
      <p>Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a connected finite
irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph and a primary vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="o\in V_{P}\Psi" text="o element-of V _ P * Psi" xml:id="S2.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is distinguished so that <Math mode="inline" tex="\deg_{\Psi}o=1" text="(degree _ Psi)@(o) = 1" xml:id="S2.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="degree" role="OPFUNCTION">deg</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
if <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p7.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> happens to have a vertex of degree 1. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p7.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called the <text font="italic">base</text> vertex of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi=\Psi_{o}" text="Psi = Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p7.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p8">
      <p>As usual, elements of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S2.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>

                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are regarded as words over the alphabet <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}=\cup_{{\alpha}\in I}G_{\alpha}" text="A = union _ (alpha element-of I) G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p8.m2">
          <XMath>

              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="union" role="ADDOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where
<Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}\cap G_{{\alpha}^{\prime}}=\{1\}" text="G _ alpha intersection G _ (alpha ^ prime) = set@(1)" xml:id="S2.p8.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMApp>

                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>

                <XMApp>

                </XMApp>

                </XMWrap>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.

    <para xml:id="S2.p9">
      <p>A nonempty word <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> over <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p9.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text font="italic">reduced</text> if every
syllable of <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> consists of a single letter.
Clearly, <Math mode="inline" tex="|W|=\|W\|" text="absolute-value@(W) = norm@(W)" xml:id="S2.p9.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p9.m4.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p9.m4.1">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p9.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p9.m4.2">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is reduced. Note that an arbitrary nontrivial element of the
free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p9.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be uniquely
written as a reduced word. A word <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text font="italic">cyclically reduced</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="W^{2}" text="W ^ 2" xml:id="S2.p9.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is reduced.
We write <Math mode="inline" tex="U\overset{0}{=}W" text="U * 0@(=) * W" xml:id="S2.p9.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="OVERACCENT">0</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if words <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S2.p9.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
are equal as elements of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p9.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The
<!--  %**** String Line 300 **** -->literal (or letter-by-letter) equality of words <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S2.p9.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.p9.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is denoted <Math mode="inline" tex="U\equiv W" text="U equivalent-to W" xml:id="S2.p9.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p10">
      <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="p=e_{1}\dots e_{k}" text="p = e _ 1 * dots * e _ k" xml:id="S2.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a path in an <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{1},\dots,e_{k}" text="list@(e _ 1, dots, e _ k)" xml:id="S2.p10.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m4.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m4.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m4.3"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p10.m4.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p10.m4.1">…</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p10.m4.3">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are edges of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="S2.p10.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, then the <text font="italic">label</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(p)" text="varphi * p" xml:id="S2.p10.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p10.m6.1">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p10.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the word <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(p):={\varphi}(e_{1})\dots{\varphi}(e_{k})" text="varphi * p assign varphi * e _ 1 * dots * varphi * e _ k" xml:id="S2.p10.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p10.m8.1">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m8.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p10.m8.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m8.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p10.m8.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p11">
      <p>The significance of irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p11.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs for geometric interpretation of factor-free subgroups <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.p11.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p11.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is given in the following lemma.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lem" inlist="thm theorem:lem" labels="LABEL:Lm1" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Lemma 2.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 2.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 2.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a finitely generated factor-free subgroup
of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=\prod_{\alpha\in I}^{*}G_{\alpha}" text="F = ((product _ (alpha element-of I)) ^ *)@(G _ alpha)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" mathstyle="text" meaning="product" name="prod" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∏</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H\neq\{1\}" text="H not-equals set@(1)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m3.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then there exists a finite connected
irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi=\Psi_{o}(H)" text="Psi = Psi _ o * H" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m5.1">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, with a base vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, such that a reduced word <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> over the alphabet <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> belongs to <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> if and only if there is a reduced path <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}(H)" text="Psi _ o * H" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m11.1">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{-}=p_{+}=o" text="p _ - = p _ + = o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(p)\overset{0}{=}W" text="varphi * p * 0@(=) * W" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m13.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m13.1">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="OVERACCENT">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="|p|=2|W|" text="absolute-value@(p) = 2 * absolute-value@(W)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m15.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m15.1">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m15.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p1.m15.2">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2">
        <p><text font="italic">In addition, assume that all factors <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, are finite and <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1},\dots,V_{k}" text="list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m3.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are words over <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then there is an algorithm which, in time polynomial of <Math mode="inline" tex="|V_{1}|+\dots+|V_{k}|" text="absolute-value@(V _ 1) + dots + absolute-value@(V _ k)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m5.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m5.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m5.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m5.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, decides whether the subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}=\langle V_{1},\dots,V_{k}\rangle" text="H _ V = list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.1">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m6.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, generated by <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1},\dots,V_{k}" text="list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m7.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, is factor-free and, if so, constructs an irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}(H_{V})" text="Psi _ o * H _ V" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.Thmthm1.p2.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.p12">
        <p>The proof is based on Stallings’s folding techniques and is somewhat analogous to the proof of van Kampen lemma for diagrams over free products of groups, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="LS" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> (in fact, it is simpler because foldings need not preserve the property of being planar for diagrams).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p13">
        <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}=\langle V_{1},\dots,V_{k}\rangle" text="H _ V = list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m1.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m1.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m1.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m1.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be a subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p13.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>,
generated by some words <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1},\dots,V_{k}" text="list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m3.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m3.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m3.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m3.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> over <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p13.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Without loss of generality we can assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1},\dots,V_{k}" text="list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m5.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m5.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m5.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m5.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m5.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are reduced words. Consider a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widetilde{}}\Psi" text="widetilde@(absent) * Psi" xml:id="S2.p13.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which consists of <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S2.p13.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> closed paths <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{1},\dots,p_{k}" text="list@(p _ 1, dots, p _ k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m8.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m8.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m8.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m8.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m8.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that they have a single common vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="o=(p_{i})_{-}" text="o = p _ i _ -" xml:id="S2.p13.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="|p_{i}|=2|V_{i}|" text="absolute-value@(p _ i) = 2 * absolute-value@(V _ i)" xml:id="S2.p13.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m10.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m10.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m10.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m10.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\dots,k" text="i = list@(1, dots, k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m11.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m11.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m11.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p13.m11.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m11.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m11.3">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
We distinguish <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p13.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as the base vertex of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widetilde{}}\Psi" text="widetilde@(absent) * Psi" xml:id="S2.p13.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and call <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p13.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> primary, the vertices adjacent to <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p13.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are called secondary vertices and so on. Denote <Math mode="inline" tex="V\equiv a_{i,1}\dots a_{i,\ell_{i}}" text="V equivalent-to a _ (list@(i, 1)) * dots * a _ (list@(i, ell _ i))" xml:id="S2.p13.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m16.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m16.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m16.1">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p13.m16.2">1</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m16.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m16.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m16.3">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m16.4">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="ell" role="UNKNOWN">ℓ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{i,j}\in{\mathcal{A}}" text="a _ (list@(i, j)) element-of A" xml:id="S2.p13.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m17.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m17.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m17.1">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m17.2">j</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are letters, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\dots,k" text="i = list@(1, dots, k)" xml:id="S2.p13.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m18.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m18.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m18.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p13.m18.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p13.m18.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m18.3">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and let
<Math mode="inline" tex="p_{i}=e_{i,1}f_{i,1}\dots e_{i,\ell_{i}}f_{i,\ell_{i}}" text="p _ i = e _ (list@(i, 1)) * f _ (list@(i, 1)) * dots * e _ (list@(i, ell _ i)) * f _ (list@(i, ell _ i))" xml:id="S2.p13.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m19.1">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p13.m19.2">1</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m19.3">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p13.m19.4">1</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.5"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m19.6"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>

                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.p13.m19.8">

            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{i,j},f_{i,j}" text="list@(e _ (list@(i, j)), f _ (list@(i, j)))" xml:id="S2.p13.m20">

        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="b_{i,j}" text="b _ (list@(i, j))" xml:id="S2.p13.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m25.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m25.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m25.1">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m25.2">j</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is an element of the group <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{{\alpha}(i,j)}" text="G _ (alpha * open-interval@(i, j))" xml:id="S2.p13.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m26.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p13.m26.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m26.1">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p13.m26.2">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>

        <p>Clearly, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(p_{i})\overset{0}{=}V_{i}" text="varphi * p _ i * 0@(=) * V _ i" xml:id="S2.p14.m1">

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\theta}(e)={\theta}(f)" text="theta * e = theta * f" xml:id="S2.p17.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m13.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p17.m13.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m13.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p17.m13.2">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we may now identify the edges <Math mode="inline" tex="e" text="e" xml:id="S2.p17.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="f" text="f" xml:id="S2.p17.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and vertices <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}" text="e _ +" xml:id="S2.p17.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{+}" text="f _ +" xml:id="S2.p17.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Observe that this folding preserves property (Q) ((P2) might fail) and decreases the total edge number <Math mode="inline" tex="|E{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}|" text="absolute-value@(E * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.p17.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m18.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p17.m18.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This operation changes the labels of edges and can be done in time polynomial in <Math mode="inline" tex="|V_{1}|+\dots+|V_{k}|" text="absolute-value@(V _ 1) + dots + absolute-value@(V _ k)" xml:id="S2.p17.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m19.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p17.m19.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m19.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p17.m19.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if
all factors <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p17.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S2.p17.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are finite. Note that if <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p17.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> were not finite, then there would be a problem with increasing space needed to store <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}" text="varphi" xml:id="S2.p17.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-labels of edges and subsequent computations with larger labels.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p18">
        <p>If property (P2) fails for edges <Math mode="inline" tex="e,f" text="list@(e, f)" xml:id="S2.p18.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)={\varphi}(f)" text="varphi * e = varphi * f" xml:id="S2.p18.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p18.m2.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m2.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{{\theta}(e)}" text="G _ (theta * e)" xml:id="S2.p18.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
