                    <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p18.m3.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then we identify the edges <Math mode="inline" tex="e,f" text="list@(e, f)" xml:id="S2.p18.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m4.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p18.m4.1">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p18.m4.2">f</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note property (Q) still holds ((P1) might fail) and the number <Math mode="inline" tex="|E{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}|" text="absolute-value@(E * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.p18.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p18.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p18.m5.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> decreases.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p19">
        <p>Suppose property (P3) fails and there are two distinct edges <Math mode="inline" tex="e,f" text="list@(e, f)" xml:id="S2.p19.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m1.1">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m1.2">f</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}" text="widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p19.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{-}=f_{-}" text="e _ - = f _ -" xml:id="S2.p19.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{+}=f_{+}\in V_{S}{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}" text="e _ + = f _ + element-of V _ S * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p19.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
If <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)\neq{\varphi}(f)" text="varphi * e not-equals varphi * f" xml:id="S2.p19.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m5.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m5.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m5.2">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{{\theta}(e)}" text="G _ (theta * e)" xml:id="S2.p19.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m6.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then a conjugate of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e){\varphi}(f)^{-1}\in G_{{\theta}(e)}" text="varphi * e * varphi * f ^ (- 1) element-of G _ (theta * e)" xml:id="S2.p19.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m7.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m7.2">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m7.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m7.3">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m7.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m7.1">e</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is in <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.p19.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, hence we conclude that
<Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.p19.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not factor-free. So we may assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(e)={\varphi}(f)" text="varphi * e = varphi * f" xml:id="S2.p19.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m10.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m10.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m10.2">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{{\theta}(e)}" text="G _ (theta * e)" xml:id="S2.p19.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m11.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Then we identify the edges <Math mode="inline" tex="e,f" text="list@(e, f)" xml:id="S2.p19.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m12.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m12.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m12.1">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p19.m12.2">f</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, thus preserving property (Q) and decreasing the number <Math mode="inline" tex="|E{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}|" text="absolute-value@(E * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.p19.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m13.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p19.m13.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If property (P3) fails so that there is a vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="v" text="v" xml:id="S2.p19.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of degree 1, different from <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p19.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then we delete <Math mode="inline" tex="v" text="v" xml:id="S2.p19.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> along with the incident edge. Clearly, property (Q)
still holds and the number <Math mode="inline" tex="|E{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}|" text="absolute-value@(E * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.p19.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p19.m17.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p19.m17.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> decreases.
<!--  %**** String Line 350 **** --></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p20">
        <p>Thus, by induction on <Math mode="inline" tex="|E{\widetilde{}}\Psi_{o}|" text="absolute-value@(E * widetilde@(absent) * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.p20.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p20.m1.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p20.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="widetilde" role="OVERACCENT">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in polynomially many
(relative to <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{i=1}^{k}|V_{i}|" text="((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ k)@(absolute-value@(V _ i))" xml:id="S2.p20.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p20.m2.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p20.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>) steps as described above, we either establish that the subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.p20.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not factor-free or construct an
irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p20.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p20.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with property (Q).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p21">
        <p>It follows from the definitions and from property (Q) of the graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p21.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> that <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.p21.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is factor-free (see also Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lm2"/>). Other stated properties of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p21.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are straightforward.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S2.p22">
        <p>Finally, we observe that if all factors <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S2.p22.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\alpha\in I" text="alpha element-of I" xml:id="S2.p22.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, are finite, then the space required to store the <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}" text="varphi" xml:id="S2.p22.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-label of an edge of intermediate graphs is constant and multiplication (or inversion) of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}" text="varphi" xml:id="S2.p22.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-labels would require time bounded by a constant. Therefore, the above procedure implies the existence of a polynomial algorithm for finding out whether a subgroup
<Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}=\langle V_{1},\dots,V_{k}\rangle" text="H _ V = list@(V _ 1, dots, V _ k)" xml:id="S2.p22.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p22.m5.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p22.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p22.m5.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok name="langle" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">⟨</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p22.m5.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S2.p22.m5.1">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p22.m5.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="rangle" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">⟩</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p22.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is factor-free and for construction of a finite irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p22.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.p22.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{V}" text="H _ V" xml:id="S2.p22.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S2.p23">
      <p>The following lemma further elaborates on the correspondence between finitely generated
factor-free subgroups of the free product <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p23.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and finite
irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p23.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graphs.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_lem" inlist="thm theorem:lem" labels="LABEL:Lm2" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Lemma 2.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Lemma 2.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Lemma 2.2</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a finite connected
irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-graph with the base vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and let
<Math mode="inline" tex="H=H(\Psi_{o})" text="H = H * Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m4.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a subgroup of the free product
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> that consists of all words <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi(p)" text="varphi * p" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m6.1">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
a path in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}" text="Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{-}=p_{+}=o" text="p _ - = p _ + = o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a
factor-free subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H)=-\chi(\Psi_{o})" text="bar@(r) * H = - chi * Psi _ o" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.1">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="chi" role="UNKNOWN">χ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m12.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="\chi(\Psi_{o})=|V\Psi_{o}|-\frac{1}{2}|E\Psi_{o}|" text="chi * Psi _ o = absolute-value@(V * Psi _ o) - (1 / 2) * absolute-value@(E * Psi _ o)" xml:id="S2.Thmthm2.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

    <para xml:id="S2.p27">
      <p>It is easy to see that an irreducible graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}(H)" text="Psi _ o * H" xml:id="S2.p27.m1">
          <XMath>

              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p27.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p27.m1.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.p27.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be obtained back from an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S2.p27.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p27.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p27.m3.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S2.p27.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by attaching a suitable path <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p27.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S2.p27.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p27.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p27.m6.1">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> so that <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p27.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> starts at a primary vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="o" text="o" xml:id="S2.p27.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, ends in <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{+}\in V_{P}\Psi(H)" text="p _ + element-of V _ P * Psi * H" xml:id="S2.p27.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p27.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p27.m9.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and then by doing foldings of edges as in the proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lm1"/>, see Fig. 2.1.</p>

      <p>Now suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S2.p28.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{2}" text="H _ 2" xml:id="S2.p28.m2">

            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are nontrivial finitely generated factor-free subgroups of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S2.p28.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Consider a set <Math mode="inline" tex="S(H_{1},H_{2})" text="S * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p28.m4">

        </Math>.
For every <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in S(H_{1},H_{2})" text="s element-of S * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p28.m9">

Similarly to articles <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Iv99,Iv01,Iv08,Iv10,Iv12" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> and analogously to the case of free groups, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="D,N2" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, we now construct a finite irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p28.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>

          </XMath>
        </Math>, also denoted <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{core}(\Psi(H_{1})\times\Psi(H_{2}))" text="core@(Psi * H _ 1 * Psi * H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p28.m13">

                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, whose connected components are irreducible core graphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(K_{s})" text="Psi * K _ s" xml:id="S2.p28.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="s\in S(H_{1},H_{2})" text="s element-of S * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p28.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p28.m15.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p28.m15.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p28.m15.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p28.m15.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>

          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p30.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p30.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

        </Math>. It is easy to see that the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\overset{\alpha}{\sim}" text="alpha@(similar-to)" xml:id="S2.p30.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="OVERACCENT">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is symmetric and transitive on pairs and triples of distinct elements (but it could lack the reflexive property).
<!--  %**** String Line 425 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p31">
      <p>The edges in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}^{\prime}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="(Psi _ o) ^ prime * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p31.m1">

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p31.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p31.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are defined so that <Math mode="inline" tex="u\in V_{P}\Psi_{o}^{\prime}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="u element-of V _ P * (Psi _ o) ^ prime * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p31.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p31.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p31.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p31.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

    <para xml:id="S2.p33">
      <p>It follows from the definitions and properties (P1)–(P2) of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o_{i}}(H_{i})" text="Psi _ o _ i * H _ i" xml:id="S2.p33.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S2.p33.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p33.m2.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p33.m2.2">2</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, that <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}^{\prime}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="(Psi _ o) ^ prime * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p33.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p33.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph with properties (P1)–(P2). Hence, taking the core of
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi_{o}^{\prime}(H_{1},H_{2})" text="(Psi _ o) ^ prime * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p33.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m5.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m5.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, we obtain a finite irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S2.p33.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-graph which we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1},H_{2})" text="Psi * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p33.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m7.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m7.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or by <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{core}(\Psi(H_{1})\times\Psi(H_{2}))" text="core@(Psi * H _ 1 * Psi * H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p33.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m8.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m8.2"/>
              </XMApp>

                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S2.p33.m8.1">core</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m8.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m8.2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m8.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p33.m8.2.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.p33.m8.2.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p34">

    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p35">
      <p>It follows from the definitions and property (P1) for <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{i})" text="Psi * H _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S2.p35.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p35.m2.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p35.m2.2">2</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, that, for every edge <Math mode="inline" tex="e\in E\Psi(H_{1},H_{2})" text="e element-of E * Psi * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p35.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="e_{-}\in V_{P}\Psi(H_{1},H_{2})" text="e _ - element-of V _ P * Psi * open-interval@(H _ 1, H _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p35.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, there are unique edges
<Math mode="inline" tex="e_{i}\in E\Psi(H_{i})" text="e _ i element-of E * Psi * H _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m5.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}(e_{-})=(e_{i})_{-}" text="tau _ i * e _ - = e _ i _ -" xml:id="S2.p35.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m6.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m6.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S2.p35.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p35.m7.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p35.m7.2">2</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Hence, by setting <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}(e)=e_{i}" text="tau _ i * e = e _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p35.m8.1">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}(e_{+})=(e_{i})_{+}" text="tau _ i * e _ + = e _ i _ +" xml:id="S2.p35.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>

                  <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m9.2"/>

                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p35.m9.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S2.p35.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, we extend <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}" text="tau _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m11">

        </Math> to the graph map</p>

      <p>It follows from the definitions that <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}" text="tau _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is locally injective and <Math mode="inline" tex="\tau_{i}" text="tau _ i" xml:id="S2.p35.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="tau" role="UNKNOWN">τ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> preserves syllables of the word <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varphi}(p)" text="varphi * p" xml:id="S2.p35.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p35.m14.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p35.m14.1">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every path <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p35.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with primary vertices <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{-},p_{+}" text="list@(p _ -, p _ +)" xml:id="S2.p35.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
