                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be reduced words and
<Math mode="inline" tex="W\mu(U_{1})W^{-1}=\mu(U_{2})" text="W * mu * U _ 1 * W ^ (- 1) = mu * U _ 2" xml:id="S5.p13.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m2.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m2.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m2.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p13.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Using induction on <Math mode="inline" tex="|U_{1}|+|U_{2}|" text="absolute-value@(U _ 1) + absolute-value@(U _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p13.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                  <XMWrap>

                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we will prove that <Math mode="inline" tex="W\in\mu({\mathcal{F}})" text="W element-of mu * F" xml:id="S5.p13.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p13.m5.1">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}" text="U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not cyclically reduced and
<Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}\equiv a_{1}U_{3}a_{2}" text="U _ 1 equivalent-to a _ 1 * U _ 3 * a _ 2" xml:id="S5.p13.m7">

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1},a_{2}\in G_{\alpha}\setminus\{1\}" text="list@(a _ 1, a _ 2) element-of G _ alpha set-minus set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p13.m8">

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are letters of <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}" text="U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then we can replace <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}" text="U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}^{\prime}:=U_{3}a_{3}" text="(U _ 1) ^ prime assign U _ 3 * a _ 3" xml:id="S5.p13.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{3}\in G_{\alpha}" text="a _ 3 element-of G _ alpha" xml:id="S5.p13.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>

          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S5.p13.m14">

              </XMApp>

          </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{3}\neq 1" text="a _ 3 not-equals 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m15">

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>

          </Math> or with <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}^{\prime}:=U_{3}" text="(U _ 1) ^ prime assign U _ 3" xml:id="S5.p13.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{3}=1" text="a _ 3 = 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and we replace <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.p13.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="W^{\prime}:=W\mu_{2}(a_{1})" text="W ^ prime assign W * mu _ 2 * a _ 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m19.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m19.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This way we obtain an equality
<!--  %**** String Line 1175 **** --></p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex13">
          <Math mode="display" tex="W^{\prime}\mu(U_{1}^{\prime})(W^{\prime})^{-1}\overset{0}{=}\mu(U_{2})" text="W ^ prime * mu * (U _ 1) ^ prime * W ^ prime ^ (- 1) * 0@(=) * mu * U _ 2" xml:id="S5.Ex13.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex13.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex13.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.Ex13.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex13.m1.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="OVERACCENT">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex13.m1.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex13.m1.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p13.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in which <Math mode="inline" tex="|U_{1}^{\prime}|+|U_{2}|&lt;|U_{1}|+|U_{2}|" text="absolute-value@((U _ 1) ^ prime) + absolute-value@(U _ 2) less absolute-value@(U _ 1) + absolute-value@(U _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p13.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m21.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m21.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m21.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m21.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m21.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m21.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m21.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m21.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence, it follows from the induction hypothesis that <Math mode="inline" tex="W\in\mu({\mathcal{F}})" text="W element-of mu * F" xml:id="S5.p13.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m22.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p13.m22.1">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, as required. If <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{2}" text="U _ 2" xml:id="S5.p13.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not cyclically reduced, then, analogously to what we did above for <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}" text="U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p13.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we can decrease the sum <Math mode="inline" tex="|U_{1}|+|U_{2}|" text="absolute-value@(U _ 1) + absolute-value@(U _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p13.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m25.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m25.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p13.m25.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p13.m25.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and use the induction hypothesis.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p14">
        <p>Thus we may assume that both words <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1},U_{2}" text="list@(U _ 1, U _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p14.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are
cyclically reduced. By part (a), the words <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U_{1})" text="mu * U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U_{2})" text="mu * U _ 2" xml:id="S5.p14.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are also cyclically reduced. Observe that if <Math mode="inline" tex="WV_{1}W^{-1}=V_{2}" text="W * V _ 1 * W ^ (- 1) = V _ 2" xml:id="S5.p14.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p14.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where
<Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1},V_{2}" text="list@(V _ 1, V _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p14.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m6.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m6.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m6.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are cyclically reduced and <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.p14.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is reduced, then <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{2}" text="V _ 2" xml:id="S5.p14.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a cyclic permutation of <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1}" text="V _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. More specifically, there is a factorization <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{1}\equiv V_{11}V_{12}" text="V _ 1 equivalent-to V _ 11 * V _ 12" xml:id="S5.p14.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S5.p14.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that if <Math mode="inline" tex="k\geq 0" text="k &gt;= 0" xml:id="S5.p14.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> then <Math mode="inline" tex="W\equiv V_{12}V_{1}^{k}" text="W equivalent-to V _ 12 * (V _ 1) ^ k" xml:id="S5.p14.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and if <Math mode="inline" tex="k\leq 0" text="k less= 0" xml:id="S5.p14.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> then <Math mode="inline" tex="W\equiv V_{11}^{-1}V_{1}^{k}" text="W equivalent-to (V _ 11) ^ (- 1) * (V _ 1) ^ k" xml:id="S5.p14.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In either case, <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{2}\equiv V_{12}V_{11}" text="V _ 2 equivalent-to V _ 12 * V _ 11" xml:id="S5.p14.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="12" role="NUMBER">12</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="11" role="NUMBER">11</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Applying this observation to the equality</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex14">
          <Math mode="display" tex="W\mu(U_{1})W^{-1}\overset{0}{=}\mu(U_{2})" text="W * mu * U _ 1 * W ^ (- 1) * 0@(=) * mu * U _ 2" xml:id="S5.Ex14.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex14.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex14.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="OVERACCENT">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.Ex14.m1.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex14.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p14.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we can see from (<ref labelref="LABEL:map2"/>), when <Math mode="inline" tex="m\geq 3" text="m &gt;= 3" xml:id="S5.p14.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, that a cyclic permutation of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U_{1})" text="mu * U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m19.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m19.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U_{2})" text="mu * U _ 2" xml:id="S5.p14.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m20.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m20.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> must have the form
<Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(\bar{U}_{1})" text="mu * (bar@(U)) _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m21.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p14.m21.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{U}_{1}" text="(bar@(U)) _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a cyclic permutation of <Math mode="inline" tex="U_{1}" text="U _ 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. For similar reasons, <Math mode="inline" tex="W\equiv\mu(V)" text="W equivalent-to mu * V" xml:id="S5.p14.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m24.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p14.m24.1">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in{\mathcal{F}}" text="V element-of F" xml:id="S5.p14.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and part (b) is proven for the subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu({\mathcal{F}})" text="mu * F" xml:id="S5.p14.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m26.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p14.m26.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It now follows that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{2}({\mathcal{F}})" text="mu _ 2 * F" xml:id="S5.p14.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m27.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p14.m27.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is also antinormal in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}_{2}(1)" text="F _ 2 * 1" xml:id="S5.p14.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p14.m28.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p14.m28.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p15">
        <p>(c) Arguing on the contrary, suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S5.p15.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a factor-free subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p15.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and one of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(H)" text="mu * H" xml:id="S5.p15.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p15.m3.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{2}(H)" text="mu _ 2 * H" xml:id="S5.p15.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p15.m4.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not factor-free in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p15.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}_{2}(1)" text="F _ 2 * 1" xml:id="S5.p15.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p15.m6.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, resp. Then it follows from the definitions that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{2}(H)" text="mu _ 2 * H" xml:id="S5.p15.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m7.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p15.m7.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not factor-free in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}_{2}(1)" text="F _ 2 * 1" xml:id="S5.p15.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p15.m8.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence, there is a reduced word <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p15.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
such that <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p15.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is not conjugate in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p15.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to a word of length <Math mode="inline" tex="\leq 1" text="absent less= 1" xml:id="S5.p15.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:e54" xml:id="S5.E5">
          <tags>
            <tag>(5.5)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">5.5</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\mu(U)\overset{0}{=}WVW^{-1}" text="mu * U * 0@(=) * W * V * W ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.E5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.E5.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.E5.m1.1">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="OVERACCENT">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p15.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.p15.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is either empty or reduced and <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p15.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is either a letter of <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}\setminus\{1\}" text="G _ 1 set-minus set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p15.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m16.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p15.m16.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p15.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
a reduced word with no letters of <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}" text="G _ 1" xml:id="S5.p15.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus, <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p15.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is reduced and either <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in G_{1}" text="V element-of G _ 1" xml:id="S5.p15.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="V\in G(2,m)" text="V element-of G * open-interval@(2, m)" xml:id="S5.p15.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m21.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p15.m21.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p15.m21.1">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p15.m21.2">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p16">
        <p>Assume that the word <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p16.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in (<ref labelref="LABEL:e54"/>) is not cyclically reduced. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="U\equiv a_{1}U_{1}a_{2}" text="U equivalent-to a _ 1 * U _ 1 * a _ 2" xml:id="S5.p16.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1},a_{2}\in G_{\alpha}\setminus\{1\}" text="list@(a _ 1, a _ 2) element-of G _ alpha set-minus set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p16.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p16.m3.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p16.m3.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p16.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p16.m3.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p16.m3.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p16.m3.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are letters of <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p16.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1}a_{2}=a_{3}" text="a _ 1 * a _ 2 = a _ 3" xml:id="S5.p16.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>

          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S5.p16.m6">

            </XMath>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, similarly to <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p16.m9">

            </XMath>

          </Math> can be replaced with

            </XMath>
          </Math>. If <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1}a_{2}=1" text="a _ 1 * a _ 2 = 1" xml:id="S5.p16.m17">
            <XMath>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be taken as <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p16.m20">

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence, by induction on <Math mode="inline" tex="|U|" text="absolute-value@(U)" xml:id="S5.p16.m21">

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we may assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p16.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is cyclically reduced.

        <p>If the word <Math mode="inline" tex="WVW^{-1}" text="W * V * W ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.p17.m1">

            </XMath>
          </Math> in (<ref labelref="LABEL:e54"/>) is not reduced, then there are words <Math mode="inline" tex="W^{\prime}" text="W ^ prime" xml:id="S5.p17.m2">

            </XMath>
          </Math>. Indeed, if, say
<Math mode="inline" tex="W\equiv W_{1}a_{1}" text="W equivalent-to W _ 1 * a _ 1" xml:id="S5.p17.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
