            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1},a_{2}\in G_{\alpha}\setminus\{1\}" text="list@(a _ 1, a _ 2) element-of G _ alpha set-minus set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p17.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m11.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m11.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m11.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m11.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m11.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p17.m11.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then we set <Math mode="inline" tex="W^{\prime}:=W_{1}" text="W ^ prime assign W _ 1" xml:id="S5.p17.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="V^{\prime}" text="V ^ prime" xml:id="S5.p17.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a reduced word equal in <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p17.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1}a_{2}V_{1}a_{1}^{-1}" text="a _ 1 * a _ 2 * V _ 1 * (a _ 1) ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.p17.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note that <Math mode="inline" tex="W^{\prime}" text="W ^ prime" xml:id="S5.p17.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="V^{\prime}" text="V ^ prime" xml:id="S5.p17.m17">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> have the foregoing properties of <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.p17.m18">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p17.m19">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, resp., and <Math mode="inline" tex="|W^{\prime}|=|W|-1" text="absolute-value@(W ^ prime) = absolute-value@(W) - 1" xml:id="S5.p17.m20">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m20.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m20.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m20.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m20.1">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="|V^{\prime}|\leq|V|+1" text="absolute-value@(V ^ prime) less= absolute-value@(V) + 1" xml:id="S5.p17.m21">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m21.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m21.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m21.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m21.1">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, whence <Math mode="inline" tex="2|W^{\prime}|+|V^{\prime}|&lt;2|W|+|V|" text="2 * absolute-value@(W ^ prime) + absolute-value@(V ^ prime) less 2 * absolute-value@(W) + absolute-value@(V)" xml:id="S5.p17.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m22.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m22.4">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m22.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p17.m22.5">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p17.m22.1">2</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m22.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m22.2">W</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m22.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m22.3">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus, by induction on
<Math mode="inline" tex="2|W|+|V|" text="2 * absolute-value@(W) + absolute-value@(V)" xml:id="S5.p17.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m23.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m23.1">W</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p17.m23.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p17.m23.2">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we may assume that the word <Math mode="inline" tex="WVW^{-1}" text="W * V * W ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S5.p17.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in (<ref labelref="LABEL:e54"/>) is reduced.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p18">
        <p>Since <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S5.p18.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is cyclically reduced and <Math mode="inline" tex="|U|&gt;1" text="absolute-value@(U) &gt; 1" xml:id="S5.p18.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p18.m2.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p18.m2.1">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it follows from part (a) that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U)" text="mu * U" xml:id="S5.p18.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p18.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p18.m3.1">U</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is cyclically reduced. Hence, the word <Math mode="inline" tex="W" text="W" xml:id="S5.p18.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">W</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is empty and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu(U)\equiv V" text="mu * U equivalent-to V" xml:id="S5.p18.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equivalent-to" name="equiv" role="RELOP">≡</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p18.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p18.m5.1">U</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p18.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a single letter of <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}\setminus\{1\}" text="G _ 1 set-minus set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p18.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p18.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p18.m7.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S5.p18.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has no letters of <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}" text="G _ 1" xml:id="S5.p18.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. However, neither situation is possible by the definition (<ref labelref="LABEL:map2"/>). This contradiction completes the proof of the first statement of part (c).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p19">
        <p>Now we will prove the equality <Math mode="inline" tex="\deg\Psi(H_{1})=\deg\Psi(\mu_{2}(H_{1}))" text="degree@(Psi) * H _ 1 = degree@(Psi) * mu _ 2 * H _ 1" xml:id="S5.p19.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="degree" role="OPFUNCTION">deg</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p19.m1.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="degree" role="OPFUNCTION">deg</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S5.p19.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m1.2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.p19.m1.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of part (c).
It follows from the definition (<ref labelref="LABEL:map2"/>) that the graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(\mu_{2}(H))" text="Psi * mu _ 2 * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m2.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p19.m2.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p19.m2.1">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
can be visualized as a graph obtained from <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p19.m3.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by subdivision of edges of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.p19.m4.1">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> into paths in accordance with formula (<ref labelref="LABEL:map2"/>) and subsequent “mergers” of edges that have labels in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{2}\cup\dots\cup G_{m}" text="G _ 2 union dots union G _ m" xml:id="S5.p19.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In particular, for every
vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in V\Psi(H)" text="v element-of V * Psi * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p19.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="\deg v&gt;2" text="degree@(v) &gt; 2" xml:id="S5.p19.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> there will be a unique vertex <Math mode="inline" tex="u=u(v)\in V_{S}\Psi(\mu_{2}(H))" text="u = u * v element-of V _ S * Psi * mu _ 2 * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m8">

              </XMApp>

          </Math> is bijective on the sets of all vertices of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m11">

          </Math>. Hence, the maximal degree of vertices of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(\mu_{2}(H))" text="Psi * mu _ 2 * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m14">
            <XMath>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is equal to that of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H)" text="Psi * H" xml:id="S5.p19.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math>, as claimed.</p>
      </para>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.p20.m21.3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.p20.m21.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="S(K_{1},K_{2})" text="S * open-interval@(K _ 1, K _ 2)" xml:id="S5.p20.m22">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p20.m22.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p20.m22.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p20.m22.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S5.p20.m22.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a set of representatives of those double cosets <Math mode="inline" tex="K_{1}SK_{2}" text="K _ 1 * S * K _ 2" xml:id="S5.p20.m23">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S5.p20.m24">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="S\in{\mathcal{F}}" text="S element-of F" xml:id="S5.p20.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, that have the property <Math mode="inline" tex="K_{1}\cap SK_{2}S^{-1}\neq\{1\}" text="K _ 1 intersection S * K _ 2 * S ^ (- 1) not-equals set@(1)" xml:id="S5.p20.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S5.p20.m26.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S5.p20.m26.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Therefore,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S5.Ex16">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(K_{1},K_{2}):=\sum_{S\in S(K_{1},K_{2})}{\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(%&#10;K_{1}\cap SK_{2}S^{-1})={\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(\mu_{2}(K_{1}),\mu_{2}(K_{2}))," text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(K _ 1, K _ 2) assign (sum _ (S element-of S * open-interval@(K _ 1, K _ 2)))@(bar@(r) * (K _ 1 intersection S * K _ 2 * S ^ (- 1))) = bar@(r) * open-interval@(mu _ 2 * K _ 1, mu _ 2 * K _ 2)" xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.1"/>
                                <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.2"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.2">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.3">
                              <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.4"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.5"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.4">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.4.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.4.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.5">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S5.Ex16.m1.3.5.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S5.Ex16.m1.3.5.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>as desired.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S5.p21">
        <p>(e) This follows from Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lemsup"/>, parts (c)–(d) and definitions.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S6">
    <tags>
      <tag>6</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§6</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">6</tag>Proofs of Theorems</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">6</tag>Proofs of Theorems</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S6.p1">
      <p>For reader’s convenience, we restate Theorems 1.1–1.3 before proving them.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_T1" inlist="thm theorem:T1" xml:id="ThmT1x1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 1.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 1.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 1.1</text></tag>.</title>
      <para xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Suppose that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}=G_{1}*G_{2}" text="F = G _ 1 * G _ 2" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the free product of two nontrivial groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p1.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a finitely generated factor-free noncyclic subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then the following claims are true.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="ThmT1x1.p2">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(a)}" text="a" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p2.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p2.m1.1">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> For every integer <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p2.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, there exists a linear programming problem (LP-problem)</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1.8)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1.8</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\mathcal{P}}(H_{1},d)=\max\{c(d)x(d)\mid A(d)x(d)\leq b(d)\}" text="P * open-interval@(H _ 1, d) = maximum@(conditional@(c * d * x * d, A * d * x * d) less= b * d)" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.8"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.8">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.1">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.7"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.9"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="mid" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.7">max</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.9">
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.2">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.3">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.4"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.4">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.5"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex1.m1.5">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex1.m1.6"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">with integer coefficients whose solution is equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="-\sigma_{d}(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="- sigma _ d * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p2.m3">

      </para>
      <para xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(b)}" text="b" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m1">

        <p><text font="italic">of the primal LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1},H_{2}^{*})=\sigma_{d}(H_{1})\bar{\mathrm{r}}(H_{1})\bar%&#10;{\mathrm{r}}(H_{2}^{*})" text="bar@(r) * open-interval@(H _ 1, (H _ 2) ^ *) = sigma _ d * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m5">

            </Math>. In particular, the WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m6">

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>

                  <XMDual>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is rational. Furthermore, if <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p3.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m9.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{2}^{*})" text="Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p3.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m10.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> denote irreducible core graphs representing subgroups <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1},H_{2}^{*}" text="list@(H _ 1, (H _ 2) ^ *)" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p3.m11.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p3.m11.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m11.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m11.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, resp.,
and <Math mode="inline" tex="|E\Psi|" text="absolute-value@(E * Psi)" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is the number of oriented edges in a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p3.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex3">
          <Math mode="display" tex="|E\Psi(H_{2}^{*})|&lt;2^{2^{4|E\Psi(H_{1})|+1+\log_{2}\log_{2}(2d)}}." text="absolute-value@(E * Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *) less 2 ^ 2 ^ (4 * absolute-value@(E * Psi * H _ 1) + 1 + (logarithm _ 2)@((logarithm _ 2)@(2 * d)))" xml:id="S6.Ex3.m1">

      <para xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(c)}" text="c" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> There exists a linear semi-infinite programming problem (LSIP-problem) <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}(H_{1})=\sup\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="P * H _ 1 = supremum@(conditional-set@(c * x, A * x less= b))" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">sup</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m2.3">
                          <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with finitely many variables in <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and with countably many constraints in the system <Math mode="inline" tex="Ax\leq b" text="A * x less= b" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> whose dual problem</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex4">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\mathcal{P}}^{*}(H_{1})=\inf\{b^{\top}y\mid A^{\top}y=c^{\top},\,y\geq 0\}" text="P ^ * * H _ 1 = infimum@(conditional-set@(b ^ top * y, formulae@(A ^ top * y = c ^ top, y &gt;= 0)))" xml:id="S6.Ex4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  </XMApp>

                      <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex4.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex4.m1.3">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex4.m1.3.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex4.m1.3.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex4.m1.3.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>

                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="1.7pt">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex4.m1.3.2">
                            <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">has a solution equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="-\sigma(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="- sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p4.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p4.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(d)}" text="d" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p5.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> Let the word problem for both groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p5.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p5.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be solvable
and let an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p5.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m3.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be given. Then the
LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) can be effectively written down and the
WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp role="FLOATSUBSCRIPT" scriptpos="3">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}(H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT1x1.p5.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m6.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> can be computed.
In addition, an irreducible core graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{2}^{*})" text="Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p5.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

      </para>

            </Math> be finite, let <Math mode="inline" tex="d:=\max(|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|)\geq 3" text="d assign maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2)) &gt;= 3" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p6.m3">

              </XMath>
            </Math>, and

              <XMath>

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

            </Math> be given.
Then the LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:lpa"/>) of part (a) coincides with the

              <XMath>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of part (c) and the WN-coefficient <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT1x1.p6.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                  <XMDual>

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
