            </XMath>
          </Math>.
<!--  %**** String Line 1350 **** -->Since <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}y(d)\neq 0" text="widehat@(absent) * y * d not-equals 0" xml:id="S6.p9.m25">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m25.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p9.m25.1">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we conclude that <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{c}^{\top}\neq 0" text="(bar@(c)) ^ top not-equals 0" xml:id="S6.p9.m26">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, hence, one of <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{j}" text="c _ j" xml:id="S6.p9.m27">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{c}^{\top}" text="(bar@(c)) ^ top" xml:id="S6.p9.m28">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
is <Math mode="inline" tex="-1" text="- 1" xml:id="S6.p9.m29">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and all other entries of <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{c}^{\top}" text="(bar@(c)) ^ top" xml:id="S6.p9.m30">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="0" text="0" xml:id="S6.p9.m31">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Since every entry of <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r}" text="A _ (r * r)" xml:id="S6.p9.m32">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is 0 or <Math mode="inline" tex="\pm k^{\prime}" text="plus-or-minus k ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p9.m33">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="-(k-2)" text="- k - 2" xml:id="S6.p9.m34">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m34.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m34.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="1\leq k^{\prime}\leq d" text="1 less= k ^ prime less= d" xml:id="S6.p9.m35">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="2\leq k\leq d" text="2 less= k less= d" xml:id="S6.p9.m36">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and every row of <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r}" text="A _ (r * r)" xml:id="S6.p9.m37">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> contains at most
<Math mode="inline" tex="d+1" text="d + 1" xml:id="S6.p9.m38">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> nonzero entries which are sums of coefficients of variables in an inequality (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>),
it follows that the standard Euclidian norm of any row of <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r}" text="A _ (r * r)" xml:id="S6.p9.m39">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is at most
<Math mode="inline" tex="(d^{2}+(d-2)^{2})^{1/2}&lt;d^{2}" text="(d ^ 2 + (d - 2) ^ 2) ^ (1 / 2) less d ^ 2" xml:id="S6.p9.m40">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m40.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m40.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m40.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m40.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="divide" role="MULOP">/</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="S6.p9.m41">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence, by Hadamard’s inequality, we obtain</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:cr1" xml:id="S6.E8">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6.8)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6.8</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="|\det A_{r\times r}|&lt;d^{2r}." text="absolute-value@(determinant@(A _ (r * r))) less d ^ (2 * r)" xml:id="S6.E8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.E8.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.E8.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.E8.m1.1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.E8.m1.1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="determinant" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">det</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p10">
        <p>Invoking the Cramer’s rule, we further have that</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:cr2" xml:id="S6.E9">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6.9)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6.9</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\widehat{}}y_{i}(d)=\frac{\det A_{r\times r,i}^{\top}(\bar{c}^{\top})}{\det A%&#10;_{r\times r}}," text="widehat@(absent) * y _ i * d = determinant@((A _ (list@(r * r, i))) ^ top * (bar@(c)) ^ top) / determinant@(A _ (r * r))" xml:id="S6.E9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.E9.m1.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.E9.m1.5">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.E9.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E9.m1.4">d</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="determinant" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">det</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.E9.m1.2"/>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.E9.m1.1"/>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.E9.m1.2">
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E9.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.E9.m1.3"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.E9.m1.3">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="determinant" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">det</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r,i}^{\top}(\bar{c}^{\top})" text="(A _ (list@(r * r, i))) ^ top * (bar@(c)) ^ top" xml:id="S6.p10.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.p10.m1.2">
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m1.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p10.m1.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the matrix obtained from <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r}" text="A _ (r * r)" xml:id="S6.p10.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> by replacing the <Math mode="inline" tex="i" text="i" xml:id="S6.p10.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>th column with <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{c}^{\top}" text="(bar@(c)) ^ top" xml:id="S6.p10.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\ldots,r" text="i = list@(1, ldots, r)" xml:id="S6.p10.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m5.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m5.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p10.m5.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S6.p10.m5.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p10.m5.3">r</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Similarly to <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{r\times r}" text="A _ (r * r)" xml:id="S6.p10.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, see (<ref labelref="LABEL:cr1"/>), we obtain that</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:cr3" xml:id="S6.E10">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6.10)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6.10</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="|\det A_{r\times r,i}(\bar{c}^{\top})|&lt;d^{2r-2}" text="absolute-value@(determinant@(A _ (list@(r * r, i)) * (bar@(c)) ^ top)) less d ^ (2 * r - 2)" xml:id="S6.E10.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.E10.m1.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="determinant" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">det</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.2"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.E10.m1.2">
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E10.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.E10.m1.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>for <Math mode="inline" tex="\|\bar{c}^{\top}\|=1" text="norm@((bar@(c)) ^ top) = 1" xml:id="S6.p10.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="norm"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p10.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p10.m7.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="top" role="ADDOP">⊤</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="|Q|" text="absolute-value@(Q)" xml:id="S6.p12.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p12.m3.1"/>

                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the cardinality of a combination with repetitions <Math mode="inline" tex="Q\sqsubseteq\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="Q square-image-of-or-equals ([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p12.m4">

              <XMApp>

                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p12.m4.1"/>

                  </XMApp>

                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p12.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p12.m4.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
defined so that every element <Math mode="inline" tex="q\in Q" text="q element-of Q" xml:id="S6.p12.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is counted as many times as it occurs in <Math mode="inline" tex="Q" text="Q" xml:id="S6.p12.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p13">
        <p>Recall that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{inq}}({\widehat{}}Y_{2})={\widehat{}}Q" text="[inq]@(widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2) = widehat@(absent) * Q" xml:id="S6.p13.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p13.m1.1"><text font="sansserif">inq</text></XMText>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p13.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
It follows from the definition of the function <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{inq}}" text="[inq]" xml:id="S6.p13.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">inq</text></XMText>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, see also Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem3"/>, that <Math mode="inline" tex="|V_{S}{\widehat{}}Y_{2}|=|{\widehat{}}Q|" text="absolute-value@(V _ S * widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2) = absolute-value@(widehat@(absent) * Q)" xml:id="S6.p13.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p13.m3.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p13.m3.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and, therefore, by (<ref labelref="LABEL:eQ"/>), we get</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:cr4" xml:id="S6.E12">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6.12)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6.12</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="|E{\widehat{}}Y_{2}|\leq 2d|V_{S}{\widehat{}}Y_{2}|=2d|{\widehat{}}Q|&lt;2drd^{2r%&#10;-2}&lt;2rd^{2r}." text="absolute-value@(E * widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2) less= 2 * d * absolute-value@(V _ S * widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2) = 2 * d * absolute-value@(widehat@(absent) * Q) less 2 * d * r * d ^ (2 * r - 2) less 2 * r * d ^ (2 * r)" xml:id="S6.E12.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.E12.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.E12.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.E12.m1.1.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.E12.m1.1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

      <para xml:id="S6.p14">
        <p>Note that <Math mode="inline" tex="r" text="r" xml:id="S6.p14.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> does not exceed the number <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S6.p14.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of variables <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{B},x_{s}" text="list@(x _ B, x _ s)" xml:id="S6.p14.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p14.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p14.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p14.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p14.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p14.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p14.m4.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p14.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p14.m4.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p14.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Since every index <Math mode="inline" tex="B" text="B" xml:id="S6.p14.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{B}" text="x _ B" xml:id="S6.p14.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a nonempty subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{P}Y_{1}" text="V _ P * Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p14.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it follows that</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:cr5" xml:id="S6.E13">

        </equation>
        <p>for <Math mode="inline" tex="|V_{P}Y_{1}|=4|EY_{1}|" text="absolute-value@(V _ P * Y _ 1) = 4 * absolute-value@(E * Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p14.m8">

            <XMath>

      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p15">
        <p>Finally, we obtain from (<ref labelref="LABEL:cr4"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:cr5"/>) that</p>

      <para xml:id="S6.p17">
        <p>Now we turn to parts (d)–(e) of Theorem 1.1.
First we discuss how to effectively write down inequalities of the system <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="d=3,4,\dots" text="d = list@(3, 4, dots)" xml:id="S6.p17.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m2.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m2.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p17.m2.1">3</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.p17.m2.2">4</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S6.p17.m2.3">…</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Recall that every inequality of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}[Y_{1}]" text="[SLI]@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p17.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p17.m3.1"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is written in the form (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>) and there are finitely many subsets <Math mode="inline" tex="A\subseteq S_{1}(V_{P}Y_{1})" text="A subset-of-or-equals S _ 1 * V _ P * Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p17.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of-or-equals" name="subseteq" role="RELOP">⊆</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m4.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">P</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> that are indices of <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p17.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> variables <Math mode="inline" tex="\pm x_{A}" text="plus-or-minus x _ A" xml:id="S6.p17.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in the left-hand sides of inequalities (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>), where <Math mode="inline" tex="2\leq k=|T|\leq d" text="2 less= k = absolute-value@(T) less= d" xml:id="S6.p17.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m7.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p17.m7.1">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The coefficient of <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{s}" text="x _ s" xml:id="S6.p17.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the integer <Math mode="inline" tex="-(k-2)" text="- k - 2" xml:id="S6.p17.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m9.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the right-hand side of (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>) is an integer <Math mode="inline" tex="-N({{\Omega}}_{T})_{\alpha}" text="- N * Omega _ T _ alpha" xml:id="S6.p17.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m10.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m10.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex10">
          <Math mode="display" tex="0\leq N({{\Omega}}_{T})_{\alpha}\leq(d-2)|V_{P}Y_{1}|," text="0 less= N * Omega _ T _ alpha less= (d - 2) * absolute-value@(V _ P * Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.Ex10.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>

                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex10.m1.1.2"/>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      </XMDual>

                        <XMApp>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>see (<ref labelref="LABEL:cd2"/>). This information is sufficient to conclude that the set of inequalities in the system <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p17.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m11.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m11.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m11.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m11.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is finite. However, this information is not sufficient to effectively write down
inequalities of <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p17.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m12.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p17.m12.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m12.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p17.m12.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> because the set of available sets <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S6.p17.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is infinite whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1}\cup G_{2}" text="G _ 1 union G _ 2" xml:id="S6.p17.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is infinite.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p18">
        <p>To explicitly write down the system <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p18.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we assume that
the word problem for both groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S6.p18.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is solvable and we will look more closely into construction of inequalities (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p19">
        <p>Recall that inequalities (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>)–(<ref labelref="LABEL:inqb"/>) are defined in Sect. 3 by using an <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}" text="alpha" xml:id="S6.p19.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-admissible function <Math mode="inline" tex="\Omega_{T}:T\to S_{1}(V_{P}Y_{1})" text="Omega _ T colon T to S _ 1 * V _ P * Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p19.m2">

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>

            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="T\in S_{2}(G_{\alpha})" text="T element-of S _ 2 * G _ alpha" xml:id="S6.p19.m3">

            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p20">
        <p>We also recall that <Math mode="inline" tex="\sim_{\Omega_{T}}" text="similar-to _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p20.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp meaning="similar-to" role="RELOP">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> denotes an equivalence relation on the set of all pairs <Math mode="inline" tex="(a,u)" text="open-interval@(a, u)" xml:id="S6.p20.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p20.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p20.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p20.m2.1">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p20.m2.2">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a\in T" text="a element-of T" xml:id="S6.p20.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="u\in\Omega_{T}(a)" text="u element-of Omega _ T * a" xml:id="S6.p20.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p20.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p20.m4.1">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, see Sect. 3. Making use of the equivalence relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\sim_{\Omega_{T}}" text="similar-to _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p20.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp meaning="similar-to" role="RELOP">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we define a relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p20.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the set <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S6.p20.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> so that <Math mode="inline" tex="a\approx b" text="a approximately-equals b" xml:id="S6.p20.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> if and only if there are <Math mode="inline" tex="u\in\Omega_{T}(a)" text="u element-of Omega _ T * a" xml:id="S6.p20.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p20.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p20.m9.1">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="v\in\Omega_{T}(b)" text="v element-of Omega _ T * b" xml:id="S6.p20.m10">
            <XMath>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="(a,u)\sim_{{{\Omega}}_{T}}(b,v)" text="open-interval@(a, u) similar-to _ Omega _ T open-interval@(b, v)" xml:id="S6.p20.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="similar-to" role="RELOP">

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note that this relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p20.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is reflexive and symmetric. The transitive closure of the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p20.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="approx" role="RELOP">≈</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is an equivalence relation on <Math mode="inline" tex="T" text="T" xml:id="S6.p20.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx_{{{{\Omega}}_{T}}}" text="approximately-equals _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p20.m15">

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The equivalence class of <Math mode="inline" tex="a\in T" text="a element-of T" xml:id="S6.p20.m16">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>

          </Math> is denoted <Math mode="inline" tex="[a]_{\approx_{{{\Omega}}_{T}}}" text="(delimited-[]@(a)) _ approximately-equals _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p20.m17">

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. It follows from the definition of <Math mode="inline" tex="[a]_{\approx_{{{\Omega}}_{T}}}" text="(delimited-[]@(a)) _ approximately-equals _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p20.m18">

        <equation labels="LABEL:t3t3" xml:id="S6.E14">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6.14)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6.14</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="b_{1}b_{2}^{-1}={\varphi}(e_{1}){\varphi}(e_{2})^{-1}" text="b _ 1 * (b _ 2) ^ (- 1) = varphi * e _ 1 * varphi * (e _ 2) ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S6.E14.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>

        <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm1.p1">
          <p><text font="italic">The equations (<ref labelref="LABEL:t3t3"/>) can be used to determine all elements of the equivalence class <Math mode="inline" tex="[a]_{\approx_{{{\Omega}}_{T}}}" text="(delimited-[]@(a)) _ approximately-equals _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.Thmthm1.p1.m1">

              </XMApp>

          </Math> is a fixed integer.
In the arguments below, this set <Math mode="inline" tex="C({\alpha},d)" text="C * open-interval@(alpha, d)" xml:id="S6.p22.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> will be held fixed. Note that if <Math mode="inline" tex="|G_{\alpha}|&lt;d^{2}+d" text="absolute-value@(G _ alpha) less d ^ 2 + d" xml:id="S6.p22.m7">
            <XMath>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, so it is not possible to choose <Math mode="inline" tex="d^{2}+d" text="d ^ 2 + d" xml:id="S6.p22.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> distinct elements in <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="S6.p22.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, then all inequalities (<ref labelref="LABEL:inqa"/>) if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}=1" text="alpha = 1" xml:id="S6.p22.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="k\leq d" text="k less= d" xml:id="S6.p22.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where as before <Math mode="inline" tex="k=|T|" text="k = absolute-value@(T)" xml:id="S6.p22.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p22.m14.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p22.m14.1">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, can be written down effectively for the following reasons: The sets

          </Math> are finite, can be written down explicitly, and it is possible to verify whether given function

          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}" text="alpha" xml:id="S6.p22.m18">

            </XMath>
          </Math>-admissible. Clearly, the same conclusion holds if both <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S6.p22.m19">

            </XMath>
          </Math> are finite but in the arguments below we will only need the inequality <Math mode="inline" tex="|C({\alpha},d)|=d^{2}+d" text="absolute-value@(C * open-interval@(alpha, d)) = d ^ 2 + d" xml:id="S6.p22.m20">

          </Math>, hence we can just assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="|G_{\alpha}|\geq d^{2}+d" text="absolute-value@(G _ alpha) &gt;= d ^ 2 + d" xml:id="S6.p22.m21">

          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p23">
        <p>Consider a subset <Math mode="inline" tex="C\subset C({\alpha},d)" text="C subset-of C * open-interval@(alpha, d)" xml:id="S6.p23.m1">

          </Math> and a set of indeterminates <Math mode="inline" tex="Z=\{z_{1},\dots,z_{k-|C|}\}" text="Z = set@(z _ 1, dots, z _ (k - absolute-value@(C)))" xml:id="S6.p23.m3">

            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note <Math mode="inline" tex="|C\cup Z|=k" text="absolute-value@(C union Z) = k" xml:id="S6.p23.m4">

              <XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Consider a function</p>

            <XMath>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.E15.m1.1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Similarly to the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\sim_{\Omega_{T}}" text="similar-to _ Omega _ T" xml:id="S6.p23.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp meaning="similar-to" role="RELOP">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined in Sect. 3, we consider a relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\sim_{{{\Omega}}_{C\cup Z}}" text="similar-to _ Omega _ (C union Z)" xml:id="S6.p23.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp meaning="similar-to" role="RELOP">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok meaning="similar-to" name="sim" role="RELOP">∼</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Omega" role="UNKNOWN">Ω</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">Z</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the set of all pairs <Math mode="inline" tex="(a,u)" text="open-interval@(a, u)" xml:id="S6.p23.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p23.m7.2">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="a\in C\cup Z" text="a element-of C union Z" xml:id="S6.p23.m8">

            <XMath>

                    </XMApp>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p23.m9.1"/>

                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, defined as follows. Two pairs

          </Math> if and only if either

            <XMath>

          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p24">
        <p>We also consider an analogue <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx_{Z}" text="approximately-equals _ Z" xml:id="S6.p24.m1">

          </Math> of the relation <Math mode="inline" tex="\approx" text="approximately-equals" xml:id="S6.p24.m2">
            <XMath>

            <XMath>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
