                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m8.5"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m8.5">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
In addition, if <Math mode="inline" tex="|E\Psi|" text="absolute-value@(E * Psi)" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m9.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m9.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> denotes the number of oriented edges of a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi" text="Psi" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m11.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is an irreducible core graph of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="d:=\max(|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|)" text="d assign maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2))" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.1">max</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.2">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMDual xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.3">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                            <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.3.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m13.3.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, then
<Math mode="inline" tex="|E\Psi(H_{2}^{*})|&lt;2^{2^{4|E\Psi(H_{1})|+1+\log_{2}\log_{2}(2d)}}." text="absolute-value@(E * Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *) less 2 ^ 2 ^ (4 * absolute-value@(E * Psi * H _ 1) + 1 + (logarithm _ 2)@((logarithm _ 2)@(2 * d)))" xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.4">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.4.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.4.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.4.1.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                          <XMApp>

                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">E</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                                    <XMDual>
                                      <XMRef idref="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.1.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.1.1">
                                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post5"/>

                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp xml:id="ThmT2x1.p4.m14.3">
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>

                                </XMApp>
                              </XMDual>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof of Theorem 1.2.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p48">
        <p>Part (a) follows from Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lm1"/>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p49">
        <p>To show part (b), we observe that, in the case when <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1},G_{2}" text="list@(G _ 1, G _ 2)" xml:id="S6.p49.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are finite, we can effectively write down the system <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p49.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m2.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="d=\max\{|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|\}" text="d = maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2))" xml:id="S6.p49.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m3.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m3.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p49.m3.1">max</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.p49.m3.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m3.2.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m3.2.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.p49.m3.3">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m3.3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m3.3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and this can be done in exponential time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Furthermore, by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lm1"/>, the size of the graph <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is polynomial in size <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{S\in{\mathcal{S}}}|S|" text="(sum _ (S element-of S))@(absolute-value@(S))" xml:id="S6.p49.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m6.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p49.m6.1">S</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the generating set <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S6.p49.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
It follows from Theorem 1.1(e) that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}[Y_{1}]=\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="[SLI]@(Y _ 1) = ([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p49.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m8.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p49.m8.1"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m8.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m8.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m8.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m8.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m8.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The size of the system
<Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}[Y_{1}]=\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]" text="[SLI]@(Y _ 1) = ([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)" xml:id="S6.p49.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m9.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m9.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p49.m9.1"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m9.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m9.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m9.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m9.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m9.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is exponential in size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence, the size of the primal LP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="\max\{-x_{s}\mid\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]\}" text="maximum@(- conditional@(x _ s, ([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)))" xml:id="S6.p49.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m11.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m11.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p49.m11.1">max</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m11.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m11.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m11.2.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m11.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m11.2.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as well as the size of the dual problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:dlpd"/>) are exponential in size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
By Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/> and Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lemsup"/>, an optimal solution to the dual problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:dlpd"/>) is equal to</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex20">
          <Math mode="display" tex="-\sigma_{d}(Y_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(Y_{1})=-\sigma_{d}(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}%&#10;}}(H_{1})=-\sigma(Y_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(Y_{1})=-\sigma(H_{1}){\bar{\mathrm{%&#10;r}}}(H_{1})." text="- sigma _ d * Y _ 1 * bar@(r) * Y _ 1 = - sigma _ d * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1 = - sigma * Y _ 1 * bar@(r) * Y _ 1 = - sigma * H _ 1 * bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="S6.Ex20.m1">

        <p>It remains to mention that an LP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="\max\{cx\mid Ax\leq b\}" text="maximum@(conditional@(c * x, A * x) less= b)" xml:id="S6.p49.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m13.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m13.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p49.m13.1">max</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m13.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be solved in polynomial time of size of the problem, see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="S86" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, and that the reduced rank <Math mode="inline" tex="{\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(Y_{1})={\bar{\mathrm{r}}}(H_{1})" text="bar@(r) * Y _ 1 = bar@(r) * H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m14.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m14.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">r</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m14.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p49.m14.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be computed in polynomial time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p49.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p50">
        <p>To prove part (c), we note that the size of the dual LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:dlpd"/>), similarly to size of
<Math mode="inline" tex="\max\{-x_{s}\mid\operatorname{\textsf{SLI}}_{d}[Y_{1}]\}" text="maximum@(- conditional@(x _ s, ([SLI] _ d)@(Y _ 1)))" xml:id="S6.p50.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p50.m1.1">max</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m1.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="mid" role="MODIFIEROP">∣</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m1.2.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m1.2.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m1.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">SLI</text></XMText>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m1.2.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, is at most exponential in size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p50.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and that
a vertex solution <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}y(d)" text="widehat@(absent) * y * d" xml:id="S6.p50.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p50.m3.1">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to (<ref labelref="LABEL:dlpd"/>) can be computed in polynomial time of
size of the dual LP-problem (<ref labelref="LABEL:dlpd"/>), see <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="S86" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. Note that here and below we use the notation of the proof of part (b) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/>. Hence, both a vertex solution <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}y(d)" text="widehat@(absent) * y * d" xml:id="S6.p50.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p50.m4.1">d</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and a combination with repetitions <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}Q" text="widehat@(absent) * Q" xml:id="S6.p50.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{sol}}_{d}({\widehat{}}Q)={\widehat{}}y(d)" text="([sol] _ d)@(widehat@(absent) * Q) = widehat@(absent) * y * d" xml:id="S6.p50.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m6.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m6.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post"><text font="sansserif">sol</text></XMText>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m6.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p50.m6.1">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be computed in deterministic exponential
time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}" text="Y _ 1" xml:id="S6.p50.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In view of inequalities (<ref labelref="LABEL:eQ"/>) and (<ref labelref="LABEL:cr5"/>), we obtain that</p>

        </equationgroup>
        <p>Therefore, a desired graph <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}Y_{2}=\Psi(H_{2}^{*})" text="widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2 = Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *" xml:id="S6.p50.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m8.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m8.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{\textsf{inq}}({\widehat{}}Y_{2})={\widehat{}}Q" text="[inq]@(widehat@(absent) * Y _ 2) = widehat@(absent) * Q" xml:id="S6.p50.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m9.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m9.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMText role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p50.m9.1"><text font="sansserif">inq</text></XMText>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m9.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
can be constructed from <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}Q" text="widehat@(absent) * Q" xml:id="S6.p50.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (this construction is similar to the proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:lem2"/>)
in deterministic double exponential time of size of <Math mode="inline" tex="Y_{1}=\Psi(H_{1})" text="Y _ 1 = Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p50.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m11.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m11.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p51">
        <p>The inequality</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex22">
          <Math mode="display" tex="|E\Psi(H_{2}^{*})|&lt;2^{2^{4|E\Psi(H_{1})|+1+\log_{2}\log_{2}(2d)}}," text="absolute-value@(E * Psi * (H _ 2) ^ *) less 2 ^ 2 ^ (4 * absolute-value@(E * Psi * H _ 1) + 1 + (logarithm _ 2)@((logarithm _ 2)@(2 * d)))" xml:id="S6.Ex22.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex22.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>

                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where, as above, <Math mode="inline" tex="d=\max(|G_{1}|,|G_{2}|)" text="d = maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ 1), absolute-value@(G _ 2))" xml:id="S6.p51.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p51.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p51.m1.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p51.m1.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p51.m1.1">max</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.p51.m1.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p51.m1.2.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p51.m1.2.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.p51.m1.3">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p51.m1.3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p51.m1.3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, follows from part (d) of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/>.
Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:th2"/> is proved. ∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>

              </XMath>
            </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d}({\widehat{}}H_{1})\geq\sigma_{d}(H_{1})" text="sigma _ d * widehat@(absent) * H _ 1 &gt;= sigma _ d * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p2.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m3.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p2.m3.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m3.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for every <Math mode="inline" tex="d\geq 3" text="d &gt;= 3" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and
<Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma({\widehat{}}H_{1})\geq\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma * widehat@(absent) * H _ 1 &gt;= sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p2.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m5.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p2.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. In particular, if the conjecture
(<ref labelref="LABEL:conjs"/>) fails for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> then the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conjs"/>) also fails for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p2.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(b)}" text="b" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> If the word problem for all groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m2">
              <XMath>

              </XMath>
            </Math>,
is solvable and a finite irreducible graph of <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

            </Math> is given, then the
LP-problem <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{P}}({\widehat{}}H_{1},d)" text="P * open-interval@(widehat@(absent) * H _ 1, d)" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m5">
              <XMath>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m6">
              <XMath>

              </XMath>
            </Math> of part (a) of Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:th1"/> can be effectively written down and the WN<Math mode="inline" tex="{}_{d}" text="_d" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p3.m7">

            </Math> can be computed.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4">
        <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\rm{(c)}" text="c" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p4.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math><text font="italic"> Let groups <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{\alpha}" text="G _ alpha" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\in I_{1}\cup I_{2}" text="alpha element-of I _ 1 union I _ 2" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>,
be finite, let <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be effectively given either by
a finite irreducible graph or by a finite generating set, and let</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex23">
          <Math mode="display" tex="d^{\prime}:=\max\{|I_{1}\cup I_{2}|,\max\{|G_{\alpha}|\,:\,{\alpha}\in I_{1}%&#10;\cup I_{2}\}\}." text="d ^ prime assign maximum@(absolute-value@(I _ 1 union I _ 2), maximum@(absolute-value@(G _ alpha) colon alpha element-of I _ 1 union I _ 2))" xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="mid" xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.2">max</XMTok>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3.1.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2.1"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="mid" xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.1">max</XMTok>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2.1">
                                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP" rpadding="1.7pt">:</XMTok>
                                  <XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2.1.1"/>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMWrap>
                                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex23.m1.3.2.1.1">
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                                    </XMWrap>
                                  </XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="union" name="cup" role="ADDOP">∪</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">Then <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{d^{\prime}}({\widehat{}}H_{1})\geq\sigma(H_{1})" text="sigma _ (d ^ prime) * widehat@(absent) * H _ 1 &gt;= sigma * H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p4.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m5.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="upright" name="widehat" role="OVERACCENT">^</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="ThmT3x1.p4.m5.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m5.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
and there is an algorithm that decides whether the conjecture (<ref labelref="LABEL:conjs"/>) holds for <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="ThmT3x1.p4.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
<!--  %**** String Line 1675 **** --></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof of Theorem 1.3.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p52">
        <p>(a) We assume that the subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p52.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is given by an irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S6.p52.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Psi(H_{1})" text="Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p52.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p52.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="\operatorname{core}(\Psi(H_{1}))=\Psi(H_{1})" text="core@(Psi * H _ 1) = Psi * H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p52.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S6.p52.m4.1">core</XMTok>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p52.m4.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m4.2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p52.m4.2.1">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Psi" role="UNKNOWN">Ψ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m4.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p52.m4.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Note that it is also possible to assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="H_{1}" text="H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p52.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is defined by a finite generating elements <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{S}}" text="S" xml:id="S6.p52.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> whose elements are words over <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S6.p52.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In the latter case, we would apply Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:Lm1"/> which, when given
a finite generating set of a subgroup <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.p52.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S6.p52.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, verifies that <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.p52.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a factor-free subgroup of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{F}}" text="F" xml:id="S6.p52.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and, if so, constructs an irreducible <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{A}}" text="A" xml:id="S6.p52.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-graph of <Math mode="inline" tex="H" text="H" xml:id="S6.p52.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">H</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p53">

Here and below we use the notation introduced in Sect. 5. Without loss of generality, we may assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="m\geq 3" text="m &gt;= 3" xml:id="S6.p53.m6">

          </Math>, otherwise we may set <Math mode="inline" tex="{\widehat{}}H_{1}:=H_{1}" text="widehat@(absent) * H _ 1 assign H _ 1" xml:id="S6.p53.m7">

            <XMath>
